name: Name
sign_in_info: Enter your email and password to sign in
register_info: Register with your username and password
level_info:
Enter your user level (1,2,3,4):
            1. Information - Research Agencies/Universities
            2. Policy - US Government, Mexican Government, NGOs
            3. Operational - Suppliers/Distributors
            4. User - Individual Users, Large Institutional Users
full_name: Full Name (include any salutations that you want us to use, e.g., Dr., Prof.)
engagement_question: For this research, we need to identify your engagement with the problem. Let us know which category best represents you.
research_agencies: Research Agencies/Universities → TAMU AgriLife, USGS, USDA-ARS, UTEP, NMSU
us_government: US Government → IBWC, USEPA, TCEQ, TWDB, Political representatives
mexico_government: Mexico Government → CILA, CEACH, CONAGUA, IMIP, BECC/NADB
ngos: NGOs → Commodity groups (e.g., pecan, cotton), Social justice organizations, Environmental justice organizations
suppliers: Suppliers/Distributors → Water Utilities, Irrigation District, USBR, Municipal utility districts
individual_users: Individual Agriculture Users → Pecan Growers (large to small holding), Cotton Growers
large_institutional_users: Large Institutional Users → Fort Bliss army base, Parks and golf courses, School districts, Industrial users
aimm_intro: AIMM (AI-driven Mental Modeler) is being developed by the
aimm_lab_description: lab at Arizona State University. This was designed as a learning and research tool for understanding the Mental Models of diverse stakeholders. We invite you to develop your Mental Model for the system and explore others.
nasa_funding: The research is supported by NASA LCLUC
nasa_project: through a research grant for the project “Exploring the Nexus between LCLUC, Socio-Economic Factors, and Water for a Vulnerable Arid US-Mexico Transboundary Region”
irb_review: This research was reviewed by ASU IRB# XXXX. For any questions, please email Saurav Kumar at
or_irb: or ASU IRB directly at XXX.
